content: in this legal case the district court in ljubljana made a decision regarding the division of assets of a deceased person the total costs of the case amount to 810 eur which the second heir is responsible for the procedure lasted for 9 months and 17 days the deceased persons assets including real estate and funds in a bank account have a total value of 170000 eur there are two heirs involved both daughters of the deceased initially the assets are divided equally between the two heirs but an adjustment is made for the first heir who is deceased and her share is assigned to the second heir therefore the second heir receives the entire share of the assets the specific articles used in the decision are 10 and 11 of the inheritance act the court determined that the deceased persons estate consists of real estate a bank account and other assets one of the daughters waived her share of the inheritance allowing the other daughter to receive the full estate the court initiated inheritance proceedings as the deceased did not leave a will the net value of the estate is 170000 eur and one of the heirs is required to pay a court fee of 810 eur the court will issue a final judgment and forward it to the land registry for registration the heir must obtain a certificate of final validity from the inheritance department of the court before borrowing funds based on the final order of succession if the appellant wishes to appeal the decision they have 15 days to do so accompanied by enough copies for all parties involved the appeal will be decided by the ljubljana high court the notice of appeal must clearly state the order being appealed and the grounds for the appeal and it must be signed by the appellant the court fee must be paid at the time of filing the appeal and if not paid within the specified time limit the appeal will be considered withdrawn the appeal can also be sent by registered post on the last day of the appeal period
